attributes.action: Instruct OFCOM that the RNLI is not to be charged increased fees for use of VHF radio
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
OFCOM has issued a consultation "Applying spectrum pricing to the Maritime and Aeronautical sectors". It is estimated that this will cost the RNLI around an extra £220,000 per year.

Peter Bradley, RNLI operations staff officer, said the charity estimated that fees would rocket from £40,000 to £260,000 a year.

He said: "It means we have got to put in a lot of extra effort in a very difficult economic climate. What we will be doing if they do apply it is extra fundraising which is quite difficult to do.

When people make donations to the RNLI it is for the saving of lives, not to pay fees to a government quango.

This petition calls for the RNLI to either be exempted from the proposed fees or to be be given a full discount.

rejection.details:
This petiton overlaps with several already in existence:

http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/RNLI-RF-licences/
